definition: to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

sentences.english: The ferrule terminal embodiment of the present invention includes a ferrule portion and a barrel portion.
sentences.chinese: 本发明的套圈端子实施例包括套圈部分和筒部分。

sentences.english: The ferrule terminal embodiment of the present invention includes a ferrule portion and a barrel portion.
sentences.chinese: 本发明的套圈端子实施例包括套圈部分和筒部分。

sentences.english: Sorry, but you have been lapped and now disqualified (DSQ).
sentences.chinese: 对不起，你因被套圈而取消比赛资格。

sentences.english: Bearing rings and rolling elements usually have a minimum hardness of 58 HRC.
sentences.chinese: 轴承套圈和滚动体通常有58人权委员会的最低硬度。

sentences.english: Cold rolling of bearing rings is a advanced process substituted for turning.
sentences.chinese: 轴承套圈的冷辗扩是一种以辗代车的先进工艺。

sentences.english: The automatic line can finish various processing one time off for bearing internal and external ring.
sentences.chinese: 本自动线可一次性完成轴承内外套圈的各种工序。

sentences.english: The experiment proves that the knitting method is better.
sentences.chinese: 实验证明采用针织套圈法织边效果更优。

definition: ancient banquet game of throwing arrows into a pot, the winner determined by the number of arrows thrown in, and the loser required to drink as punishment
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
Chinese rings, a brainteaser toy consisting of nine rings interlocked on a looped handle, the objective being to remove the rings from the handle
